input: Tell me a paragraph bio of Michael Collins (astronaut).
output: Michael Collins, an American astronaut and retired Air Force pilot, played a crucial role in the historic Apollo 11 mission, the first manned mission to land on the moon. Born in Rome, Italy, on October 31, 1930, Collins joined NASA in 1963 and served as the pilot for the Gemini 10 mission before being selected as the command module pilot for Apollo 11 in 1969. During the mission, Collins remained in orbit around the moon, piloting the command module and ensuring a safe return to Earth for his fellow astronauts, Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin. Despite being absent from the lunar landing, Collins conducted experiments and took photos of the moon's surface. After retiring from NASA in 1970, Collins pursued a successful career in aerospace and became an advocate for space exploration. He left behind a legacy of courage, determination, and dedication to the advancement of space exploration, earning him the nickname 'the loneliest man in history' and the title of 'the forgotten astronaut.' Collins passed away on April 28, 2021, at the age of 90, leaving a lasting impact on the world of space exploration.

input: Tell me a paragraph bio of Huang Xing.
output: Huang Xing, born in 1874 in Hunan province, emerged as a prominent Chinese revolutionary leader and military commander who played a pivotal role in the overthrow of the Qing dynasty. A close associate of Sun Yat-sen, Huang Xing was instrumental in organizing the revolutionary forces for the Wuchang Uprising in 1911, marking the beginning of the Xinhai Revolution that led to the establishment of the Republic of China. Serving as the commander-in-chief of the National Revolutionary Army and the first commander-in-chief of the Republic of China's armed forces, Huang Xing demonstrated strong leadership, strategic vision, and unwavering dedication to the cause of revolution. He was a founding member of the Kuomintang and founded the Chinese Revolutionary Alliance, leaving behind a legacy as a patriotic hero and a key figure in China's transition from imperial rule to republican government. Despite facing obstacles and challenges, Huang Xing remained committed to the cause of revolution until his passing in 1916, remembered as one of the founding fathers of modern China and a fearless patriot.
